accuracy.description: The degree to which the solution's final answer is correct with respect to the real-world problem posed.

completeness.description: The extent to which the solution addresses all components of the task, including the steps required and the analysis of the provided data.

efficiency.description: How effectively the multi-agent system utilizes resources (e.g., time, computational power) to solve the problem.

logical_coherence.description: The soundness of the reasoning process and whether the solution's reasoning trace follows a logical sequence.

error_handling.description: The system's ability to handle and respond to discrepancies, such as the described empty file conflict.

adaptability.description: The system's capability to adapt its approach when encountering unforeseen issues or incomplete information.

data_handling.description: The proficiency with which the system processes and analyzes data, even when faced with challenges like empty or incorrectly described files.

communication_clarity.description: The clarity and conciseness of the responses and instructions shared among agents.

use_of_resources.description: The system's ability to leverage available agents and their capabilities effectively.

progress_tracking.description: The ability to monitor and report on the progress being made toward achieving the goal.

question_handling.description: The system's capability to appropriately address and analyze the complexities of the posed question.
